alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Montgomery; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:59PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pike, northwestern Bullock and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 659 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hardaway to Dublin. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Union Springs, Meadville, Pine Level, Kent, Dublin, Naftel, Franklin Field, Shopton, Ansley, Grady, Ramer, Lapine, High Ridge, Orion, China Grove, Mitchell, Currys and Simsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
